commits.subject: refactor: new extraction architecture with two triggers
commits.body:
- "hatch the chicken" = full reset, AI analyzes ALL commits
- "feed the chicken" = incremental, AI analyzes only NEW commits
- processed/ folder is source of truth (persistent)
- reports/ folder removed (was ephemeral)
- Deleted scripts/tag-commits.js (AI analyzes directly)

commits.subject: Merge pull request #17 from devmade-ai/claude/separate-coding-data-personas-hFBpV
commits.body: feat: add @coder and @data persona triggers

commits.subject: docs: update session notes with two-stage extraction process

commits.body:

- Update EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md to include per-repo tagging in Step 4
- Document use of tag-commits.js script for efficient tagging

commits.subject: chore: tag all 586 commits with AI analysis
commits.body:
- Added scripts/tag-commits.js for consistent tagging
- Applied playbook rules to all commits
- Tag breakdown: feature(160), bugfix(68), docs(79), cleanup(241), etc.
- All commits have tags and complexity (1-5) assigned

commits.subject: refactor: separate script extraction from AI tagging
commits.body:
Scripts now extract raw data only (empty tags, null complexity):
- extract.js: Removes tag parsing logic, outputs tags: [], complexity: null
- aggregate.js: Passes through empty tags (no 'other' default)

AI (@data persona) will analyze each commit and assign:
- tags[] based on playbook guidelines
- complexity (1-5) based on files changed + tag count

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new two-stage process.

commits.subject: chore: update extracted data (584 commits across 4 repos)

fix: remove tag limits, focus on consistency in playbook
docs: add tagging guidelines for @data consistency
docs: update extraction playbook for @data persona
fix: make @coder the default persona
feat: add @coder and @data persona triggers
commits.body:
Two personas for focused interactions:
- @coder: development work (code, bugs, features, architecture)
- @data: extraction and processing (playbooks, reports, aggregation)

"feed the chicken" is now a command within @data persona.

commits.subject: chore: update extracted data (570 commits across 4 repos)
refactor: remove all vanity metrics from dashboard
commits.body:
Audit and cleanup - removed every element that shows meaningless counts:

Progress Tab:
- Remove: Monthly Commit Volume, Cumulative Lines charts
- Add: Complexity Over Time chart

Contributors Tab (complete rework):
- Remove: Commits by Contributor, Lines by Contributor charts
- Remove: Contributor Details list
- Add: "Who Does What" - work type breakdown per person
- Add: Complexity by Contributor chart

Timeline Tab:
- Remove: Commit Timeline chart
- Remove: +/- lines from commit display
- Add: Complexity badge on each commit

Summary Tab:
- Remove: "Top Contributor", "Busiest Day" highlights
- Remove: "Avg commits/day" stat
- Add: "Complex Changes", "Quality Work" highlights

Dashboard now shows only meaningful work metrics:
what kind of work, who does what, and how complex it is.

commits.subject: refactor: replace vanity metrics with meaningful work metrics
commits.body:
Remove commits/lines focus, add metrics that actually matter:

Summary Cards:
- Lines Added → Files Changed (scope)
- Lines Removed → Avg Complexity (1-5)
- Commits → Top Work Type (focus)

Executive Summary:
- Commits → Features Built
- Contributors → Bugs Fixed
- Add Complexity + Files Touched with trends

The dashboard now shows what kind of work is being done,
how complex it is, and how much of the codebase is affected -
not vanity metrics like line counts.

commits.subject: feat: add PDF export and shareable links (Priority 4)
commits.body:
Add export/share capabilities to the dashboard:

- PDF Export: Generate downloadable PDF of current tab view
  - Uses html2pdf.js for client-side generation
  - Includes header, stats, and chart content
  - Landscape A4 format with loading feedback

- Shareable Links: Copy URL with encoded state
  - Captures tab, filters, period, timezone settings
  - Auto-applies URL state on page load
  - Toast notifications for user feedback

- UI: Header buttons (Share + Export PDF)
  - Responsive layout (icons on mobile)
  - Buttons appear after data loads

Completes all Discovery Session priorities (1-4).

commits.subject: feat: implement tag-based extraction with complexity scoring
commits.body:
Phase 1 - extract.js:
- Add CONVENTIONAL_TO_TAG mapping (feat→feature, fix→bugfix, etc.)
- parseCommitMessage() returns tags[] array instead of single type
- Add calculateComplexity() function (1-5 scale)
- Summary outputs tagBreakdown and complexityBreakdown
- Contributors/files track tagCounts instead of types

Phase 4 - aggregate.js:
- Tag-aware aggregation with tagCounts
- Summary outputs tagBreakdown and complexityBreakdown
- Monthly aggregation tracks tags per month

Data regenerated for repo-tor with new format.
Docs updated (USER_GUIDE, HISTORY, SESSION_NOTES, TODO).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: feat: add multi-tag support to dashboard
commits.body:
- Replace single type field with tags[] array model
- Add TAG_COLORS and tag helper functions (getCommitTags, getAllTags, getTagColor, getTagClass)
- Rename "Type" filter to "Tag" filter (matches any tag)
- Show all tags on commits (up to 3 with overflow indicator)
- Rename "By Type" tab to "By Tag" tab
- Update Progress tab Feature vs Bug Fix for tag-based counting
- Update combineDataFiles() to build tagBreakdown

Dashboard expects tags[] field - will show "other" until extraction is updated.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: docs: refocus on tag-based analytics with AI-driven extraction
commits.body:
Shift tool focus to three core metrics:
- When: timestamp analytics (hour, day, work hours, weekends)
- What: AI-analyzed tags from commit messages (multiple per commit)
- Complexity: score based on files changed + tag count

Add EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with "feed the chicken" trigger phrase.
Reorganize TODO.md around new direction (Foundation → Views → Polish).
Remove completed items from TODO (tracked in HISTORY.md).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Merge pull request #9 from devmade-ai/claude/add-todo-timestamp-views-9u4BW
commits.body: docs: add feature roadmap for timestamp views, filters, design, and privacy

commits.subject: docs: add research items for commit model improvements
commits.body:
New Research/Investigation section in TODO.md:

1. Device/Platform Attribution
   - Split contributions by committer name (mobile vs desktop)
   - Config mapping for name variations with device tags

2. AI-Powered Commit Categorization
   - Claude reads commit messages + diffs to understand intent
   - Auto-tagging beyond conventional commit types
   - Confidence scores and human override

3. Multi-Tag Commit Model
   - One commit can have multiple tags (feat + refactor + docs)
   - Schema change from single type to tags[] with weights
   - Backward compatibility with existing data

4. Tag-Centric Reporting
   - Shift focus from commit counts to accomplishments
   - Effort weighting based on complexity
   - Activity vs output distinction

- USER_GUIDE.md: Dashboard UI walkthrough, chart interpretation, metric

User guide focuses on "what does this mean?" while admin guide
focuses on "how do I set this up?"

commits.subject: docs: add commit convention guide and validation hooks
commits.body:
D2 deliverable - Commit Convention Guide:
- docs/COMMIT_CONVENTION.md: Full guide for conventional commits
  with type definitions, examples, and analytics impact
- .gitmessage: Git commit template for consistent formatting
- hooks/commit-msg: Validation hook for commit message format
- hooks/setup.sh: Installation script for git hooks

Run ./hooks/setup.sh to enable validation.

commits.subject: Add Git Analytics Reporting System
commits.body:
- scripts/extract.js: Node.js extraction script with git log parsing,
  conventional commit detection, keyword-based type fallback, and
  structured JSON output
- scripts/extract.sh: Shell wrapper for easier usage
- dashboard/index.html: Static analytics dashboard with Chart.js
  - Timeline: daily commit chart, recent commits list
  - Progress: monthly volume, cumulative growth, feature vs fix trends
  - Contributors: commits and lines by author
  - Security: highlighted security-related commits
  - Types: pie chart and percentage breakdown
- Updated .gitignore to exclude generated reports/
- Updated docs with usage documentation

commits.subject: Initial commit
